reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have high hopes for this but so far I am completely unimpressed.

Currently this is in a nearly unplayable (and frustratingly confusing) state.

If you know how to play other games of the genre such as Master of Orion then it wont help you here.  The movement method consistes of: Click ship,  drag a yellow line to your LINEAR ONLY destination, Right click.  Hope it takes".  If it doesnt
date:
(and normally it doesnt) repeat.  Until you get a green line with another yellow line next to is.  then right click and hope it doesnt change or erase your straight line flight path.

Combat is also confusing.  I couldnt get my ships to fire on the first 2 tries at combat.  So I played the tutorial.  That was an exercise in frustration since 90% of the time I did what it said it wouldnt target the ship.  It gave no explanation why or hints how to do so.  then my entire fleet in the tutorial was obliterated on the first turn.

the main play screen looks alot like Galactic Empires 2 but less pretty.  (this is not a good thing since that is one of the worst of the genre)

I sure hope this gets a lot better!"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is the game I've been wating for. Lack of features yet but lots of fun so far. Even in it's EA state this game is enjoyable for everyone who's interested in space strategy games.

Leveling systems, upgradable buildings, research functions and competetive AI are missing to this date but I think they're gonna patch those things in the future.

As long as you're matchin up with some friends in a multiplayer game you'll really love its simple but deep strategic mechanics. One thing I don't like is the soundtrack, annoying as hell after a couple of hours. But thats just my opinion.

Looking forward to a really good, yet addicting game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EARLY ACCESS
I recommend this because I believe it has the potential, in its current state all you can really do is do a battle and get a feel for what kind of mechanics this game is going to have. I am very optimistic, I like the cartoon Art style and the gameplay (while buggy as to be expected) is good. Just like the Forest and Subnautica, both were bare bones in the beginning but for those of whom played them on launch day, they had the makings of great games. This title strikes me in a similiar way!
(No Cap'n Kibs were stricken in the writting/recording of this review)

30 Minutes or Less, has potentail. Also If you get it do the tutorial the UI is a bit lack luster
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m3XOFKIanUo&list=PLNtPp4M-LVW-RJYbhJha2iqZ7wSZOZI5H&index=2

Thanks for Reading, I hope this review gave you a better understanding of the game. Let me know your thoughts in the comments on what you think of this game?

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI buy a lot of bundles, mostly to farm cards, but I try out all the games at least briefly for the 1 in a 50 that isn't complete garbage.  One thing I've come to realize is that if the game opens with the Unity settings box or with the Made in Unity" splash screen
date: it's almost always going to be a piece of junk.  So it wasn't looking good for this one.  But then it started by asking me if I'd like to play the tutorial.  Yes
hoursPlayed: that's a good sign that maybe the game's not total shovelware.  But then the tutorial launches
voteText: and I'm baffled at how a tutorial could fail so badly.  Is the "tutorial" intended to be a joke on purpose?  It just dumps you into a jumbled screen with no information on what is happening
helpfulPercent: what you are supposed to do
votesTotal: etc. and provides absolutely zero tutoring of any kind.  Quit
commentsCount: into the "Garbage" category in my library

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nDon't buy this. I know you can get it cheap on sale but unless you are so well off that you can throw money away I would not buy it, Just look at the forum. No activity from either developer or players -- its just dead, You get the feeling that the developer does just enough to meet the obilgations to the publisher (Iceberg) and nothing more. I can't condone a business practice of taking people's money and basicallly doing nothing.
Early Access Review\n\nI can't really describe this game in words except AWESOMENESS
